titleStmt.title: By the Lord Deputy and Council. Tyrconnel. Whereas several merchants of this kingdom have driven a considerable trade in salting of salmon, and making them up in many parcels, and transporting them beyond the seas, which brought to them considerable returns, ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
Tyrconnel, Richard Talbot, Earl of, 1630-1691.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook and Samuel Helsham assigns of Benjamin Tooke, printer to the King's Most Excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at His Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-Street,

notesStmt.note: "Given at the Council-Chamber in Dublin the 7th day of March, 1686".
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
